revised_title: Investigating Periodicity and Spatial Distribution of Measles Epidemics in London, 1890-1912
tldr: This study investigates the periodicity and spatial distribution of measles epidemics in London from 1890 to 1912. The research finds that various periodicities exist, with the 87-week and 97-week epidemics being the most prominent. The findings contribute to understanding the spread and prevalence of measles epidemics in different districts of London.
